game.zilch

Class DicePool

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.zilch.DicePool

  • public class DicePool
extends java.lang.Object
    Dice Pool class manages a group of dice. Can have several dice be held from rolling the group.
    Author:
    nick & chad

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DicePool()
      Default constructor makes no dice.
      DicePool(int numberOfDice, int maxValue)
      Sets up a dice pool with a specific amount.

      Returns a list of dice of a certain value.

      If this is set to true then it means the dice pool is heterogenous; or, in other words, the pool has dice that have different ranges

    • Constructor Detail

      • DicePool

        public DicePool()
        Default constructor makes no dice. This can be expanded by addDie and addDice.

      • DicePool

        public DicePool(int numberOfDice,
        int maxValue)
        Sets up a dice pool with a specific amount. For zilch, this will be 6 and 6.
        Parameters:
        numberOfDice - Number of dice in dice pool
        maxValue - The maximum value the dice can achieve in this initial set

    • Method Detail

      • addDice

        public boolean addDice(int numberOfDice,
              int maxValue)
        Add a set of dice. It can have different sizes from what already exists in the pool
        Parameters:
        numberOfDice - number of dice to be added.
        maxValue - the max value of the dice to be added.
        Returns:
        true if all of the dice were successfully added.

      • addDie

        public boolean addDie(int maxValue)
        Adds one die at one specific value.
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The highest the die can be rolled at
        Returns:
        true if the die was added

      • areAllDiceHeld

        public boolean areAllDiceHeld()
        This is important in Zilch because we need to know if all of the dice are held.
        Returns:
        true if all dice are held

      • diceByLastValue

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<Die>> diceByLastValue()
        Returns a list of dice of a certain value. Keep in mind that initialized dice start at 0, so 0 is a possible outcome if the die was not rolled.
        Returns:
        List of Lists. Each sublist is a list of dice at the value within the index.

      • getAllDice

        public java.util.List<Die> getAllDice()

      • getMaxValue

        public int getMaxValue()

      • isMixedPool

        public boolean isMixedPool()
        If this is set to true then it means the dice pool is heterogenous; or, in other words, the pool has dice that have different ranges
        Returns:
        True if mixed pool, false if not.

      • rollAll

        public void rollAll()
        Issues roll to the collection of dice

      • removeAllAtMaxValue

        public boolean removeAllAtMaxValue(int maxValue)

      • removeAllDice

        public boolean removeAllDice()

      • removeDie

        public boolean removeDie(Die d)
        Removes the Die using the reference to the Die. This is probably the best way to remove the die besides by value
        Parameters:
        d - The die you want to remove from the list
        Returns:
        true if removing the die was successful.

      • setAllHold

        public void setAllHold(boolean hold)
        Issues setHold to all dice. Usually used for resetting hold

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of dice in the dice pool
        Returns:

      • totalsByValue

        public int[] totalsByValue()
        Returns a table of totals in an int[] array.
        Returns:
        Array of numbers. Each index is a value for the maxValue, so the number of elements is actually maxValue + 1 where the 0th index is for dice that happen to not be ever rolled.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A basic toString that will print out all of the values of last rolls in no particular order.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String in a digit + space format.
